author: Ted Byrne
content:
Filters are the photographic artist's brushes. They surmount problems, extend feelings, and snigger ideas into the balance of an image. A reason I resist the Lens Baby is that it leaves so little ability to nuance an idea... it leaves its user stuck with a massive intrusion onto a frame. Filters reverse that - letting the artist select rather than cope. All of which you've done here by not permitting the SnapArt intrusion to overcome your intent. Of course I totally like what you've done and appreciate the lesson it imparts. 

Totally evocative....
